question:
You wanted to start your own business. Write a letter to a friend
Tell him/her about your business 
Explain why you think it is a good idea
Ask him/her help for some help or advice
text: I hope you're doing fine. I'm writing to inform you about the trade I'm about to commence in March. It's a fantastic business that you can benefit from, trust me.
It is a clothing venture that will cater to both adults and children. The required startup capital is not so expensive and I've seen a designer who would supply these clothes at good prices

Since there is no  store within my neighbourhood in this field, I thought it'll be a great idea to open a store and stock both formal and informal clothes for people. Also, I think I would see good patronage because most people have to drive almost one hour to the main mall and do their shopping.

Furthermore, I would like to request  your advice on the accounting and staffing of my new company if possible. I have some challenges on how to reconcile my accounts, draw out staff packages and their benefits.
I look forward to hearing from you soon so that I can also run my business successfully like yours.
